headline: Software firm Vinci, which speeds up hardware simulation, raises $36 million
summary: Startup Vinci said on Tuesday it ​has raised $36 million to finance its business of building software ‌that can speed chip and other hardware design by significantly accelerating the simulation of such ‌devices.  The Palo Alto, California-based company's software is entering a crowded market that has similar artificial intelligence-based simulation products made by established chip software design companies such as Cadence and Synopsys.  Vinci said its simulation software uses ⁠an in-house-built ‌AI model to boost the speed of chip simulation.

headline: Stock Index Futures Gain as Investors Recover Risk Appetite
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.27%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are up +0.39% this morning, signaling a rebound from yesterday’s sell-off on Wall Street as investor risk appetite gradually returns at the start of December, a period that has historically been strong for markets.

headline: Is NVIDIA’s (NVDA) $2 Billion Synopsys AI Partnership Reshaping Its Engineering Software Strategy?
summary: NVIDIA and Synopsys recently announced an expanded multiyear partnership to accelerate engineering software using NVIDIA AI and computing, alongside a US$2 billion NVIDIA investment in Synopsys and a slate of joint AI initiatives for industries such as semiconductors, automotive, and aerospace. This collaboration not only integrates advanced AI workflows and digital twin solutions into engineering software but also expands the reach of NVIDIA’s accelerated computing platforms across a broad...

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Inch Higher as Factory Slowdown Persists
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Tuesday, Dec, 2 2025 US stock futures are pointing slightly higher ahead of the opening bell, as investors weigh two main forces shaping the market. On one hand, the cost to borrow money, measured by the yield on the 10-year US Treasury note, is staying near 4.1%. This number is important because when these yields go up, it makes loans more expensive for households and businesses, putting pressure on growth. On the other hand, new data shows US...
